ygData.subject: Re: how do i start pottery
ygData.msgSnippet: ... trivial ... the skill ... things after ... are selling ... of ... makers.But ... On the subject of cha raising items, in Qeynos, on the plaza by the docks,
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Z.M. Kulik" <direhawk@...>
>
>There are two ways: The Fastest way, and the economical way.
>The Fastest way: Have about 13pp ready,start making ceramic lining until
trivial
>(about 36)Than Pie tins until about 115.This is the fastest way to raise
the skill
>and start making money.If you dont have about 13pp than make different
things after
>36,because Pie tins will fail about 95% of the time at skill 36.When you
are selling
>or buying,it helps a LOT to have charisma enhencing items or spells.(Medal
of
>merit,SOS spell for shamans)After skill 115 Mixing bowls are good money
makers.But
>the most money will be made with Pie tins.
>i pay 1silver 1 copper for pie tin sketch,pie tins sell for 6 gold and 4
>silver,(Medal of merit +5 Char,SOS +15 Char,Char doll +3 Char)
>
>Gillaen (Prexus)
>
>"T. J. Mangrich" wrote:
>


On the subject of cha raising items, in Qeynos, on the plaza by the docks,
there
is a woman npc under an awning (Iala something?) who sells a "Fine Silk
Evening
Shirt" Char + 5. Pretty cheap for the benefit as well. Since, if your
doing pottery
or another trade skill, your probably not fighting, swapping that for your
armor
before buying or selling may be worth it.
